questions.question: He showed ……………………………. late.
questions.description: To show up is to arrive late.

questions.question: I don’t mind your coming late, but don’t wake me ………………………..
He never wasted a single opportunity to show ............................... his wealth.
questions.description: To show off is to demonstrate haughtily.

questions.question: The child was told to keep ............................... from the pond.
questions.description: To keep away is to remain at a distance.

questions.question: She passed ............................. before she could utter a word.
questions.description: To pass out is to faint.

questions.question: He went .............................. to talk amidst protests.
questions.description: To go on is to continue.

questions.question: We don't have a lot of money. We just manage to get ...............................
questions.description: To get by is to survive.

questions.question: When they sprinkled cold water on his face, he came .................................. again.
questions.description: To come to is to regain consciousness.

questions.question: His rude behavior put me ...................................
questions.description: Put off can mean deter or discourage.

questions.question: Grandpa often drops ................................
questions.description: To drop by is to visit without appointment.

questions.question: I was late because the car broke .............................. on the way.
questions.description: To break down is to stop functioning.

questions.question: He was let ................................. with a warning.
questions.description: To let somebody off is to punish them lightly.
